title: Vast signs agreement with Czech government
summary: Commercial space station developer Vast Space has signed an agreement with the government of the Czech Republic that could allow a Czech astronaut fly on a future mission by the company.

title: Sierra Space expands spaceplane fleet with in-house mission control
summary: LOUISVILLE, Colorado — The long-awaited inaugural cargo flight of Sierra Space’s Dream Chaser spaceplane has been delayed to no earlier than May 2025, pushing back a launch previously expected this […]

title: BlackSky buys Thales Alenia’s stake in LeoStella joint venture
summary: BlackSky has taken full ownership of smallsat manufacturer LeoStella, giving the remote sensing company greater control over the production of its next generation of imaging satellites.

title: Czechia Partners With VAST for Possible Private Astronaut Mission
summary: The Czech Ministry of Transport has signed a memorandum of understanding with the US-based private space station company Vast to explore a potential private astronaut mission. During the most recent round of the European Space Agency’s astronaut selection process, Aleš Svoboda from Czechia was one of twelve selected for a brand-new designation, Astronaut Reserve. Put […]

title: Earth from Space: Autumn foliage across Europe
summary: This compilation of images, captured by the Copernicus Sentinel-2 mission, showcases the characteristic hues of autumn in different European countries.

title: Hera burns towards Mars
summary: ESA’s Hera mission has completed the first critical manoeuvre on its journey to the Didymos binary asteroid system since launch on 7 October.

title: NASA defends selection of astrophysics probe mission proposals
summary: NASA defended the selection of two concepts for study as the agency’s first astrophysics probe-class mission amid community complaints that the two missions are not on an equal footing.

title: SpaceX targets Starship Flight 6 launch on November 18
summary: This will be the fastest turnaround for the Starship program as SpaceX works towards what needs to become a weekly launch cadence for NASA's Artemis program. Liftoff is set for no earlier than 4 p.m. CST (5 p.m. EST, 2200 UTC) on Nov. 18.

title: Oral History with Stephen G. Jurczyk, 1962 – 2023
summary: Steve Jurczyk’s NASA career began in 1988 at Langley Research Center as an engineer in the Electronic Systems Branch. During his time at Langley, he served in other roles, including director of engineering and director of research and technology.  Jurczyk was named as director of Langley in 2014, then in 2015 he left Langley to […]

title: Viasat seeking Telesat LEO capacity as Starlink competition mounts
summary: Geostationary operator Viasat is in advanced talks to buy broadband capacity from Telesat’s future low Earth orbit satellites as competition from Starlink is set to intensify in the incoming Trump Administration.
